key_points: Nichole Schmidt recalls cherished memories of her daughter Gabby Petito, particularly their last moments together.
A new documentary, The Murder of Gabby Petito: Truth, Lies, and Social Media, explores Petito's life and the events leading up to her tragic death.
Petito's parents and stepparents share their fondest memories in the documentary.
Gabby Petito disappeared during a cross-country trip with fiancé Brian Laundrie.
Petito's body was found on Sept. 19, near Grand Teton National Park, Wyoming; her death was ruled a homicide by strangulation.
Brian Laundrie returned home alone on Sept. 1 and was identified as a person of interest in Petito's killing.
Laundrie's remains were found in late October in Florida, and his death was ruled a suicide.
Federal authorities and prosecutors in Wyoming have asked the Petito family to withhold comment on the case.
The family of Gabby Petito has been informed of the circumstances surrounding Laundrie's suicide but has been asked to let the FBI continue their investigation.
Laundrie's parents refused to cooperate with police while Gabby was still considered missing.
